item.title: Martin Thomas: Nazareth Man House – S3E15
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we talk with Martin Thomas. Martin was incarcerated in Indiana state prison with a 50-year sentence, where he discovered that many men who get let out end up back in prison. While Martin was still incarcerated, he decided to start working on a plan to help this problem. The Nazareth Man House was born. The Nazareth Man House helps previously incarcerated men build skills to help keep them out of prison. Listen to hear Martin tell more about his story and what the Nazareth Man house and Foresight For-Givers Foundation does.

LINKS:

  • Nazareth Man House on Instagram
  • Foresight For-Givers

item.title: John Kauffman : Big Brother – S3E14
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we talk with John Kauffman. John is part of the Big Brother / Big Sister program. After John's kids were older and moved out, John decided to become a big brother to a young man. He tells us about some of the adventures he goes on, and what it means to invest in the life of a young person.

item.title: Sean Clifford: Canopy Parental Control App – S3E13
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we talk with Sean Clifford of the Canopy parental control app. Sean is a father of 4 who wants to make the digital world safer for kids all over. He founded canopy and created an app that uses artificial intelligence to search for and actively remove pornography from web pages and images. It also helps keep kids from sexting. Hear more about the app and what it can do in this episode.

item.title: Greg Serafino: Worshiping God In The Grief -S3E12
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
Greg worked in the steel industry, and then he felt the calling to go into ministry and is now a pastor. Greg became the modern-day Job when his son was killed, then one month later, both of his in-laws were killed in a car accident, and one month after that, his dad was diagnosed with cancer, and a few short weeks later, he died. He also had a daughter that found out she was pregnant and then lost the child early in the pregnancy. Through all this, Greg has chosen to worship God in the grief.

LINKS:

item.title: Darin Shrock: Adoptive Parent -S3E4
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we continue in our two-part series about adoption. We brought our friend Darin Shrock to the studio to talk about his experience with adoption. Darin and his wife have adopted four children from Ethiopia. Darin and his wife also run a non-profit Awake & Alive. Awake & Alive is a champion for educating children in Ethiopia, Africa.

item.title: Pregnancy And Infant Loss
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
October is pregnancy and infant loss awareness month. 1 in 4 pregnancies ends in a loss. In this episode, Joel and Andy talk about the stillbirth that Andy’s family experienced in 2014. They talk about how people can support their friends experiencing loss and other support options.

item.content:encoded:
October is pregnancy and infant loss awareness month. 1 in 4 pregnancies ends in a loss. In this episode, Joel and Andy talk about the stillbirth that Andy’s family experienced in 2014. They talk about how people can support their friends experiencing loss and other support options.

item.title: Matt Miller, Bryan Chris: The Inner Circle of Dads
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we talk with our good friends Matt Miller and Bryan Chris. These two men have been some of our closest friends for the longest time. We have done lots of life together. We talk about what they love about being a dad, what it was like to send their kids to school this year, tough conversations, and things that bring them joy. Listen in on this conversation with the close friends of Joel DeMott and Andy Lehman

item.title: Chuck Lehman: The Art Of Resting And Retreating
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we talk with Chuck Lehman. Chuck and his wife Becka run a retreat ministry/facility, called Shepherd's Gate Inn, in Martinsville Indiana. Chuck talks with us about the importance of resting and retreating, and why as men we don’t stop to take time and rest. Chuck is also Andy’s dad so after the show we recorded some extra bonus content where he tells us funny stories about Andy growing up. Check the links below for that bonus content for our patreon supporters.

item.title: Joe Rudy: Loving Kids In Your Community Even When It Is Tough
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
Joe was doing social work when he was called to youth ministry. Needing to make some extra money for a trip with his son, he took on a part-time job driving school bus on a route that no one else wanted. He befriended the kids. When one day there was a school shooting at the local school and Joe had a connection to the shooter.

item.title: Bob Morton
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
In this episode, we talk with Bob Morton. Bob is a former Notre Dame football player who gave up going pro and became a pastor. When Bob had a career change and left the pastoral ministry, it changed his life. We talk about grieving the lost of the pastoral ministry, and how he is now raising his kids, how being a dad while traveling for his new job looks, and trying to remember his dad while parenting differently than his dad did.

LINKS:

Bob Morton on Twitter
Bob Morton on LinkedIn

item.description:
Cory Witmer stopped by the studio to chat about the recent death of his father. He talks with us about how he managed during that time. item.title: Kids and Devices
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: On this episode, Joel and Andy talk about children and their use of cell phones, tablets, TV, and more. We talk about what the stats say and what we can do about it. We give some practical advice on how to stop letting devices rule our kid’s lives. We also draw our winner from our #DudesAndDadsAtTheFair contest and let them know what they won. We mentioned in this episode about the K9 Browser, after the episode we found out that this is no longer available. There are other browsers available like Covenant Eyes LINKS: http://www.growingwireless.com/get-the-facts/quick-facts http://www.techaddiction.ca/media-statistics.html https://www.covenanteyes.com/ https://www.concretebarber.com/ Support our show on Patreon Youtube video

item.title: Fathers Day
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: Happy fathers day, friends. We know that this day is not always an easy day for many men. Men who have lost their father, or lost a child due to stillbirth, miscarriage, or other death. Men, we are here for you. Being fathers day, we wanted to bring our own children on the show and chat with them a little about being our kids. Joel’s children were out of town so we only brought Andy’s kids in this round. We ask the kids many questions ranging from what they like to do with Andy, to qualities they hope to pass to their own kids. On
item.content:encoded:
Happy fathers day, friends. We know that this day is not always an easy day for many men. Men who have lost their father, or lost a child due to stillbirth, miscarriage, or other death. Men, we are here for you.

Being fathers day, we wanted to bring our own children on the show and chat with them a little about being our kids. Joel’s children were out of town so we only brought Andy’s kids in this round. We ask the kids many questions ranging from what they like to do with Andy, to qualities they hope to pass to their own kids. On this episode you will hear two songs that Andy made up to try and pass values on to his kids.

We know this episode is a little different from our normal episodes and we hope you enjoy hearing from our kids.

Thank you all for participating in the “Dear Boys” book give away. We draw the winner and announce it on this show.

Thanks for all your support. If you would like to support the show please join our other fine patrons at https://dudesanddadspodcast.com/support and become a patreon today!

LINKS:

YouTube video of the show
item.itunes:subtitle: Happy fathers day, friends. We know that this day is not always an easy day for many men. Men who have lost their father, or lost a child due to stillbirth, miscarriage, or other death. Men, we are here for you. Being fathers day,
item.itunes:summary:
Happy fathers day, friends. We know that this day is not always an easy day for many men. Men who have lost their father, or lost a child due to stillbirth, miscarriage, or other death. Men, we are here for you.



Being fathers day, we wanted to bring our own children on the show and chat with them a little about being our kids. Joel’s children were out of town so we only brought Andy’s kids in this round. We ask the kids many questions ranging from what they like to do with Andy, to qualities they hope to pass to their own kids. On this episode you will hear two songs that Andy made up to try and pass values on to his kids.



We know this episode is a little different from our normal episodes and we hope you enjoy hearing from our kids.



Thank you all for participating in the “Dear Boys” book give away. We draw the winner and announce it on this show.



Thanks for all your support. If you would like to support the show please join our other fine patrons at https://dudesanddadspodcast.com/support and become a patreon today!



LINKS:



YouTube video of the show
item.itunes:author: Joel and Andy
item.itunes:title: Fathers Day

item.title: Batman, Superman, and Indiana Jones
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: On this episode we talk about why its best if we are not men like the super heroes, who do not need anyone else. We chat about why we need others to help us. Joel has a group of men that he regularly sends prayer requests to, Andy use to have a group that he could go to and ask for help and accountability. As men we can not do this life alone and we should have regular people who can speak into our lives, and our children should see this modeled in their parents lives. This episode talks about the importance of having others
item.content:encoded:
On this episode we talk about why its best if we are not men like the super heroes, who do not need anyone else. We chat about why we need others to help us. Joel has a group of men that he regularly sends prayer requests to, Andy use to have a group that he could go to and ask for help and accountability. As men we can not do this life alone and we should have regular people who can speak into our lives, and our children should see this modeled in their parents lives. This episode talks about the importance of having others available for you.

We also give details on how you can win the book “Dear Boys: The letter every son needs from his father.

item.content:encoded:
On this episode we talk with Dustin Kaehr about his book “Dear Boys: The Letter Every Son Needs From His Father”. Dustin is an Author, Speaker, and Coach. In his book, “Dear Boys” he talks about creating a letter to his sons that will teach them the core of what he would want them to know when/if he were to pass away. In this book Dustin lays out a framework that you can use to create a letter for your son’s also. The book is designed to be read with your son too. There are questions in the back of each chapter for both the father, the son, and for both to answer.

item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: On this episode we talk with our friends Nolan Rhodes, Tristan Clark, and Cory Eash about their generation, Generation Z. item.content:encoded:
On this episode we talk with our friends Nolan Rhodes, Tristan Clark, and Cory Eash about their generation, Generation Z.

This is the first show in our dudes of the square table format. On dudes of the square table episodes we invite a panel of guests to talk about a specific subject.

We talk about misconceptions that other generations have about them, what makes them tick . With generation Z there is “extended adolescence”, we ask our guests if they are experiencing this themselves or see it in their friends. We also talk about community and what that looks like to them. Gen Z also delays marriage, parenthood, first-home, our friends on this episode talk about this idea, as well as how do they make big life decisions.

This is only part one of our discussion about generation Z. On episode 5 we will continue our talk with Cory, Nolan, and Tristan.

We thank our patrons who financially keep this show running. See http://patreon.com/dudesanddadspodcast to join our fine patrons.

Links mentioned on the show

Dutch Blitz Wiki
Generation Z – What turns them on
Meet Generation Z: Understanding and Reaching the New Post-Christian World

item.title: Grieving Dads
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: On this episode Joel and Andy talk about what it is like to be a grieving dad. In April of 2014 Andy and his wife Julie were pregnant with their 4th child, Macyn. Macy was stillborn. We talk about the grief process Andy experienced and helpful ways to support people in your life who maybe experiencing the loss of a child. If you have experienced child loss or know someone who has, please send us an email dudesanddadspodcast at gmail.com. I (Andy) would love to chat with you. Links Mentioned in the show HopeMommies.orgNorthern Indiana Hope Mommies Facebook PageSpark of Life retreat

item.title: Clarence Hogan: Growing up without a father and leading out of his deficit
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: In this episode we talk with Clarence Michael Hogan. He grew up without a father and in his deficit has used his gifts and talents to lead. Out of the deficit he has become a youth leader, and provides direction to young kids as well as being a foster dad. We also talk about how there is mass abandonment even in middle class suburban areas. Links Mentioned in the show: Clarence’s Instagram Clarence’s FacebookAlone Together Book Geocachingpodcast.com avadchiropratic.com thriveleadership.center It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men. Frederick Douglass
